TASK_CRUD_GOAL.description: Create, Update, Delete, Read and Duplicate goal in Asana
TASK_CRUD_GOAL.instillShortDescription: Goal Related Task, including get, update, delete, create, duplicate

input.description: Goal Related Task, including get, update, delete, create, duplicate

goal-gid.description: Globally unique identifier (GID) for the goal. You can find the GID of a goal from the URL of the goal in Asana. For example, if the URL of the goal is https://app.asana.com/0/goal/1234567890, then the GID is 1234567890.
goal-gid.title: Goal ID

goal-gid.description: Globally unique identifier (GID) for the goal. You can find the GID of a goal from the URL of the goal in Asana. For example, if the URL of the goal is https://app.asana.com/0/goal/1234567890, then the GID is 1234567890.
goal-gid.title: Goal ID

due-on.description: The date on which the goal is due. In the format YYYY-MM-DD.
due-on.title: Due Date

start-on.description: The date on which the goal starts. In the format YYYY-MM-DD.
start-on.title: Start Date

liked.description: Whether the goal is liked by the user.
liked.title: Liked

status.description: The current status of this goal. When the goal is open, its status can be green, yellow, and red to reflect "On Track", "At Risk", and "Off Track", respectively. When the goal is closed, the value can be missed, achieved, partial, or dropped.
status.title: Status

goal-gid.description: Globally unique identifier (GID) for the goal. You can find the GID of a goal from the URL of the goal in Asana. For example, if the URL of the goal is https://app.asana.com/0/goal/1234567890, then the GID is 1234567890.
goal-gid.title: Goal ID

due-on.description: The date on which the goal is due. In the format YYYY-MM-DD.
due-on.title: Due Date

start-on.description: The date on which the goal starts. In the format YYYY-MM-DD.
start-on.title: Start Date

liked.description: Whether the goal is liked by the user.
liked.title: Liked

workspace.description: GID of the workspace. You can find one by filling the access token in the Asana API Playground
workspace.title: Workspace

time-period.description: GID of the time period. You can find one by filling the workspace id in the Asana API Playground
time-period.title: Time Period

owner.description: User GID of the Owner. You can find one by filling the workspace id in the Asana API Playground
owner.title: Owner

input.title: Input

gid.description: Globally unique identifier (GID) for the goal.
gid.title: Goal ID

gid.description: Globally unique identifier (GID) for the owner.
gid.title: Owner ID

html-notes.description: The notes of the goal in HTML format.
html-notes.instillShortDescription: The notes of the goal in HTML format.
html-notes.title: Goal HTML Note

due-on.description: The date on which the goal is due. In the format YYYY-MM-DD.
due-on.title: Due Date

start-on.description: The date on which the goal starts. In the format YYYY-MM-DD.
start-on.title: Start Date

liked.description: Whether the goal is liked by the user.
liked.title: Liked

likes.description: The users who likes the goal.
likes.instillShortDescription: The users who likes the goal.
likes.title: Likes

like-gid.title: Like ID

user-gid.description: Globally unique identifier (GID) for the user.

workspace.title: Workspace ID

team.description: Globally unique identifier (GID) for the team of the new project.
team.instillShortDescription: Team ID of the new project
team.title: Team ID

project-gid.description: Globally unique identifier (GID) for the project. You can find the GID of a goal from the URL of the project in Asana. For example, if the URL of the project is https://app.asana.com/0/goal/1234567890, then the GID is 1234567890.
project-gid.title: Project ID

name.description: The name of the new project.
name.title: New Project Name

team.description: Globally unique identifier (GID) for the team of the new project. If team is not defined, the new project will be in the same team as the the original project.
team.instillShortDescription: Team ID of the new project
team.title: Team ID

due-on.description: Sets the last due date in the duplicated project to the given date. The rest of the due dates will be offset by the same amount as the due dates in the original project. In the format YYYY-MM-DD.
due-on.instillShortDescription: Due Date (You should only specify exactly one of due-on or start-on)
due-on.title: Due Date

start-on.description: Sets the first start date in the duplicated project to the given date. The rest of the start dates will be offset by the same amount as the start dates in the original project. In the format YYYY-MM-DD.
start-on.instillShortDescription: Start Date (You should only specify exactly one of due-on or start-on)
start-on.title: Start Date

should-skip-weekends.description: Determines if the auto-shifted dates should skip weekends.
should-skip-weekends.instillShortDescription: Determines if the auto-shifted dates should skip weekends.
should-skip-weekends.title: Should Skip Weekends (For auto-shifted dates)
